name: Ana Liffey Drug Project (ALDP)
legal: Registered Charity; Company Limited by Guarantee
memberOrga: We are not a network, and as such have no members.
goal:
The Ana Liffey Drug Project is a national addiction service in Ireland operating from a low threshold, harm reduction ethos. We provide a range of direct social and medical services and support to people who use drugs and their families. Our vision is for a society where all people affected by problem substance use are treated with dignity and respect and have access to quality services.
Our mission is to work with people affected by problem substance use and the organisations that assist them. We do this to reduce harm to individuals and society, and to provide opportunities for development of those individuals and organisations.

We also operate on a policy level internationally and are represented on the Civil Society Forum on Drugs (CSFD).
interests: Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Employment and Social Affairs, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Institutional affairs, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives: We are current members of the Civil Society Forum on Drugs (CSFD).
